items.title: New research reveals how everyday cues secretly shape your habits
bullets: • A shift in a key brain protein can accelerate habit formation by amplifying dopamine-driven learning signals
• When this protein drops, dopamine neurons fire more intensely, strengthening new associations in ways that resemble how addictive behaviors take hold
• This process helps determine whether the brain responds to signals that lead to positive behaviors or ignores cues tied to harmful habits

items.title: Oldest evidence of human fire-making unearthed in Britain

• New study suggests humans were deliberately starting and using fires more than 400,000 years ago
• Early humans depended on nature to start one, like lightning striking a tree
• Archaeologists believe that humans and our ancestors have used fire for more than a million years

items.title: A dead whale shows up on your beach. What do you do with the 40-ton carcass?
bullets: • When a whale dies, its body descends to the bottom of the deep sea in a transformative phenomenon called a whale fall
• An estimated 20,000 whales are fatally hit each year; sometimes a ship captain rolls into harbor unaware a 40-ton body is draped across their bow
• Mass whale deaths have been linked to marine heatwaves and the toxic algae blooms that follow

• Health officials are warning people not to forage for wild mushrooms at all during this high-risk season
• One person was killed and three required liver transplants, but all survived

items.title: Forget flowers: These ancient plants attract pollinators by getting hot

• They're related to pines, and male and female plants each produce fleshy, pine-cone-like structures that contain pollen and seeds

items.title: Drinking water contaminated with Pfas probably increases risk of infant mortality, study finds
bullets: • First-of-its-kind University of Arizona research found drinking well water down gradient from a Pfas-contaminated site was tied to an increase in infant mortality of 191%, pre-term birth of 20%, and low-weight birth of 43%
• The cost of complying with current regulations for removing Pfas in drinking water is estimated at about $3.8bn

items.title: Weekend predictions: Zootopia likely winner in last weekend before the Holiday rush
bullets: • Zootopia 2 is the clear favorite to come top at the box office this weekend
• Five Nights at Freddy’s 2 likely to take a steep fall from its $64-million opening last weekend
• Wicked: For Good should land third, with Ella McCay (the only new release playing in over 2,000 theaters) and How the Grinch Stole Christmas looking likely to battle for fourth and fifth places

items.title: Theater counts: Zootopia 2 fends off a surge of new titles to retain its spot as the widest release.
bullets: • Zootopia 2 scored $158.8 million in its first five days at the domestic box office and snatching the number one spot from Wicked: For Good
• This weekend the two top contenders will face off with a bevy of newcomers, including another sequel, looking to unseat the current champs
• The widest of those newcomers is Five Nights at Freddy’s 2, which starts out in 3,412 theaters

items.title: The Numbers Business Report: our official forecast for 2026
bullets: • The Numbers Business Report: our official forecast for 2026 box office
• Box office receipts are projected to reach $9.8 billion, a 10% increase on the anticipated 2025 total of $8.87 billion
• The Super Mario Galaxy, due on April 3, tops the slate with forecast receipts of $550 million
• Mid‑tier wide releases are forecast to generate $4.57 billion, up 10% year on year

items.title: Holiday theater counts: Wicked continues its reign as Zootopia 2 enters the arena
bullets: • Wicked: For Good racked up an impressive $147 million in its debut this past weekend
• Zootopia 2 brings back detectives Judy Hopps and Nick Wilde, who are once again partners in the police force, but their working relationship is under strain
• Walt Disney will release the sequel in 4,000 theaters throughout North America

items.title: Weekend projections: Wicked: For Good soars to $150-million domestic debut
bullets: • Wicked: For Good will storm to $150 million this weekend, according to Universal’s Sunday-morning projection
• That should give it the second-best weekend of 2025, behind A Minecraft Movie's $162.8 million
• The studio is projecting $76 million overseas for a $226 million global debut
